I'll treat this review as an extension of my original half-life 2 reviews. This episode felt a bit lacklustre (relative) but then again, the bulk of the story happened in Half-life 2. It's unfortunate that I'm unable to pick up combined weapons inside the Citadel until the very end, It's also very frustrating trying to hit the targets with the orbs when it covers my cursor, but perhaps you could just consider that part of the challenge. Another issue I've picked up on especially when inside the citadel is how confusing to navigate it can be when all the walls are the same duplicated texture. I'll finish with a few more positives I noticed: The zombies sound more scared than anything, you can still hear the fear of the human the head-crab occupies, I think this is way more powerful than any other method of showing fear. Fighting in the dark using flares or your limited-use flashlight really adds to the immersion, the effect of not being able to see is much more powerful than being able to see. 

I shall now continue to pursue my schizoid para-social relationship with Alyx.
not as good as the main game, in fact, i feel like this was made to give alyx more screen time. But i still enjoyed it.

One of the best games ever created for any platform, period. Valve made such a solid physics-based game that it holds up solidly almost two decades later. The graphics, while dated at this point, remained ahead of their time for years after the game was released. The rock-solid physics based puzzles and gameplay are unrivaled today, with the only real contender being the physics sandbox presented by BotW. Valve took the winning gameplay loop from the original HL and just added on - more lore, more weapons, more enemies, larger maps, better character models, better AI... they took what worked and ran with it. The game is an incredible sequel in an incredible franchise.
Everybody should play the Half-Life series.

Fun game, more Half-Life 2 but with an even greater focus on the gravity gun. Pretty annoying that we have to slowly get our arsenal back especially when they waste our time with giving us the regular pistol and smg which are both outclassed completely by their upgrades but its pretty good. I see some sites saying this game will take you 4-6 hours to complete but I completed it in a little under 2 hours so this is a very short game.

Esta expansion del Half life 2 cumple con continuar la historia donde se quedo en el juego base, sin embargo es una experiencia un poco breve tomando en cuenta que solo es un escape combinado con el hecho que impone el reto de no tener armas al inicio del juego tomando en cuenta la seccion del anterior, pese a que algunas partes se sienten tediosas como tal no lo catalogaria como un mal juego, una expansion suficiente.
NOTA: Estoy a un juego de ponerle fin a un ciclo.
